item.title: 阿克曼的美国潘兴广场公司将在纽约上市，股票发行价为 50 美元
item.description: 由亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）管理的基金 Pershing Square USA 周五表示，计划在纽约首次公开发行股票，每股发行价为 50 美元。【原文：Pershing Square USA, a fund managed by billionaire Bill Ackman, said on Friday it plans to offer shares at $50 each in its initial public offering in New York.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，菲斯科将在美国召回 8,000 多辆 Ocean 汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周五表示，电动汽车公司菲斯科（Fisker）将在美国召回8204辆 "海洋"（Ocean）汽车，原因是该车的外门把手可能会被卡住而无法打开。【原文：Electric-vehicle firm Fisker is recalling 8,204 Ocean vehicles in the U.S. due to an issue where exterior door handles can stick and fail to open, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Friday.】

item.title: 拜登在与特朗普的辩论中表现不佳，特朗普媒体股价攀升
item.description: 在乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统与共和党竞争对手唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在 2024 年首场美国总统辩论中表现不佳之后，特朗普媒体与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）的股票在周五的盘前交易中最多上涨了近 13%。【原文：Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group rose as much as nearly 13% in premarket trading on Friday after President Joe Biden's faltering performance against Republican rival Donald Trump at the first 2024 U.S. presidential debate.】

item.title: 意大利向谷歌索赔 10 亿欧元未付税款
item.description: 三位直接了解此事的消息人士周五表示，意大利正在要求谷歌支付 10 亿欧元（10.7 亿美元）的未缴税款和罚金，这是在这家美国公司与罗马当局解决了具有里程碑意义的税务纠纷七年之后。【原文：Italy is asking Google to pay 1 billion euros ($1.07 billion) in unpaid taxes and penalties, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday, seven years after the U.S. company settled a landmark tax dispute with Rome authorities.】

item.title: 欧盟监管机构将在 8 月 1 日前就 140 亿美元的惠普-瞻博网络交易做出决定
item.description: 欧盟委员会网站周五发布的一份文件显示，欧盟反垄断监管机构将在8月1日前决定是否批准惠普企业公司以140亿美元收购网络设备制造商瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）的交易。【原文：EU antitrust regulators will decide by Aug. 1 whether to clear Hewlett Packard Enterprise's $14 billion acquisition of networking gear maker Juniper Networks , a filing on the European Commission website showed on Friday.】

item.title: 关键通胀数据公布倒计时，期货上涨，特朗普媒体飙升
item.description: 纳斯达克和 S&P 500 指数期货周五上涨，原因是美联储密切关注的一份报告显示通胀有望缓和，而特朗普媒体&科技集团的股价在乔-拜登（Joe Biden）在总统辩论中表现不佳后跳涨。【原文：Nasdaq and S&P 500 futures rose on Friday on hopes of inflation moderating in a report closely monitored by the Federal Reserve, while Trump Media & Technology Group's shares jumped after a weak showing from Joe Biden in a presidential debate.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴金称将 "审慎 "制定政策
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）周五表示，尽管他相信美国央行迄今为止的加息措施最终将足以使通胀率下降，但政策可能并不像人们普遍认为的那样紧缩。【原文：Richmond Federal Reserve Bank President Thomas Barkin on Friday said that while he believes the U.S. central bank's interest-rate hikes to date will be enough to bring inflation down eventually, policy may not be as tight as is widely thought.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士透露，雷普索尔公司正在与 NEO 就合并英国北海业务进行谈判
item.description: 三位业内消息人士称，西班牙雷普索尔公司（Repsol）正在与私募股权支持的 NEO Energy 公司洽谈合并其英国北海油气业务，这是在该海盆运营的公司在税收压力加大的情况下进行的最新整合努力。【原文：Spain's Repsol is in talks to merge its UK North Sea oil and gas business with private equity-backed NEO Energy, three industry sources said, the latest consolidation effort by companies that operate in the basin amid greater tax pressures.】

item.title: 气候活动人士计划在花旗银行纽约总部举行抗议活动
item.description: 气候活动人士正计划在周五举行一场针对花旗集团纽约总部的游行，这是他们所谓的 "炎热之夏 "活动的一部分。【原文：Climate activists are planning a march targeting Citigroup's headquarters in New York on Friday, part of what they call a "Summer of Heat" campaign.】

item.title: 丰田将于 2025 年在中国推出首款配备先进自动驾驶系统的电动汽车
item.description: 丰田在中国的一家合资企业表示，丰田计划明年在中国市场推出首款配备先进自动驾驶系统的电动汽车车型，该系统类似于特斯拉的全自动驾驶系统。【原文：Toyota is planning to launch the first electric car model equipped with an advanced autonomous driving system similar to Tesla's Full Self-Driving for the Chinese market next year, one of its Chinese joint ventures said.】

item.title: 消息人士称，雷普索尔公司正在探索出售南得克萨斯州石油资产的少数股权
item.description: 西班牙石油巨头雷普索尔公司（Repsol）计划出售其在南得克萨斯州伊格尔福特页岩资产的少数股权，三位熟悉谈判的消息人士告诉路透社，这笔交易的价值可能高达 20 亿美元。【原文：Spanish oil major Repsol plans to sell a minority interest in its Eagle Ford shale assets in South Texas, in a deal that could value the assets at up to $2 billion, three sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.】

item.title: 早间新闻解析拜登电视失利、法国民调、PCE时间
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 诺基亚斥资 23 亿美元收购英飞朗，迎合人工智能热潮
item.description: 诺基亚出价 23 亿美元收购美国光网络设备制造商英飞朗（Infinera），使这家芬兰公司有望从涌入数据中心的数十亿美元投资中获益，以迎合人工智能的崛起。【原文：Nokia's bid to buy U.S. optical networking gear maker Infinera in a $2.3 billion deal puts the Finnish company on track to gain from the billions of dollars in investment pouring into data centres to cater to the rise of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 汉莎航空首席执行官表示，飞机交付延迟对汉莎航空造成了 "残酷 "的影响
item.description: 汉莎航空首席执行官卡斯滕-施波尔（Carsten Spohr）表示，飞机交付问题对汉莎航空造成了 "残酷 "的影响，而且在本十年结束前不会得到解决。【原文：Aircraft delivery issues are having a "brutal" impact on Lufthansa and will not be resolved before the end of the decade, according to CEO Carsten Spohr.】

item.title: 英国数以千计的汇丰银行客户遭遇网上银行故障
item.description: 周五，英国汇丰银行（HSBC）的数千名客户无法访问网上银行服务，该银行承认其网站和银行应用程序的部分用户受到了故障影响。【原文：Thousands of HSBC customers in Britain were unable to access online banking services on Friday, as the bank acknowledged an outage affecting some users of its website and banking app.】

item.title: 雷诺支持的 BeyonCa 计划制造香港首批电动汽车
item.description: 由雷诺和东风汽车支持的高级电动汽车制造商BeyonCa周五表示，计划在香港建立总装厂和国际总部，打造香港首个汽车品牌。【原文：Premium EV maker BeyonCa, backed by Renault and Dongfeng Motor , said on Friday it plans to set up a final assembly plant and its international headquarters in Hong Kong, developing the territory's first car brand.】

item.title: 耐克前景黯淡拖累 JD Sports 和彪马，阿迪达斯短暂上扬
item.description: 周五，JD Sports 和彪马的股价分别下跌了 6.6% 和 3%，而阿迪达斯的股价则短暂上涨了 1.5% 以上，因为美国同行耐克周四预测 2025 财年的收入将意外下降。【原文：Shares in JD Sports and Puma fell as much as 6.6% and 3% respectively on Friday, while Adidas briefly rose over 1.5%, after U.S. peer Nike on Thursday forecast a surprise fall in fiscal 2025 revenue.】

item.title: 汇丰银行的布洛克斯汉姆称，特朗普连任可能导致大宗商品市场分化
item.description: 汇丰银行的一位经济学家周五表示，如果美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普在11月5日的大选中获胜连任，大宗商品市场将面临更大的分裂和供应中断。【原文：Commodity markets face greater fragmentation and supply disruptions if former U.S. president Donald Trump wins the Nov. 5 election to return for a second term, an HSBC economist said on Friday.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯可能在 8 月份连续第二个月下调亚洲市场油价
item.description: 贸易消息人士周五称，由于中东基准迪拜原油价格疲软，头号石油出口国沙特阿拉伯可能在8月份连续第二个月下调销往亚洲的原油价格。【原文：Top oil exporter Saudi Arabia may cut prices for crude grades it sells to Asia for a second month in August, tracking weakness in Middle East benchmark Dubai, trade sources said on Friday.】

item.title: 尽管增长乏力，交易商仍对全球并购前景持乐观态度
item.description: 第二季度，全球并购（M&A）活动增长乏力，但许多交易商对此持乐观态度，预测交易量将在 2024 年下半年回升。【原文：Global mergers and acquisitions (M&A) activity grew at a sluggish pace in the second quarter, yet many dealmakers are upbeat, forecasting transactions will pick up in the second half of 2024.】

item.title: 聚焦：巴黎拉德芳斯寻求复兴，打造更小、更环保的办公楼
item.description: 巴黎的拉德芳斯商业区正在将 30 多万平方米（320 万平方英尺）的办公室改造成更环保、更灵活的办公空间，以吸引企业回归，缓解创纪录的高空置率。【原文：Paris's La Defense business district is betting that modernising more than 300,000 square metres (3.2 million sq. ft) of offices into greener and more flexible work space will lure back companies and ease record high vacancy rates.】

item.title: 2024 年上半年美股表现强劲，大选和美联储风险迫在眉睫
item.description: 在美股锁定稳健的上半年业绩之际，投资者正在猜测政治不确定性、美联储潜在的政策转变以及大型科技公司的市场主导地位是否会使 2024 年余下的时间变得更加艰难。【原文：As U.S. stocks lock in a solid first half, investors are speculating whether political uncertainty, potential Federal Reserve policy shifts and big tech's market dominance could make the rest of 2024 a tougher slog.】

item.title: 独家报道数据显示，制造普京赠送给金正恩的汽车的公司使用了韩国零部件
item.description: 上周，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京和朝鲜领导人金正恩乘坐俄罗斯制造的 "极光 "豪华轿车，在平壤周围嬉笑打闹，展示他们加强了的反西方联盟。【原文：Laughing and joking, Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un cruised around Pyongyang last week in a Russian-made Aurus limousine to showcase their strengthened anti-Western alliance.】

item.title: NTSB 称波音公司若再次违规，将失去 737 MAX 探针资格
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会（National Transportation Safety Board）周四警告波音公司，由于它违反规定向媒体提供非公开信息并猜测可能的原因，它可能会失去作为737 MAX空中爆炸事故调查方的地位。【原文：The National Transportation Safety Board warned Boeing on Thursday it could lose its status as a party to the probe into a 737 MAX mid-air blowout after it violated rules by providing non-public information to media and speculating about possible causes.】

item.title: 欧洲 所有道路都通向美元
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 至少四家公司在香港首次公开募股，筹资约 5 亿美元
item.description: 根据监管文件显示，从美国的喷气机制造商到中国的生成式人工智能公司，至少有四家公司于周五在香港进行了首次公开募股，募集资金高达 5 亿美元。【原文：At least four companies ranging from a U.S.-based jet manufacturer to a Chinese generative AI firm launched Hong Kong initial public offerings on Friday to raise up to $500 million, according to their regulatory filings.】

item.title: 习近平呼吁在贸易和外交摩擦中架设 "桥梁
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平周五呼吁在全球经济中搭建 "桥梁"，因为中国政府正在努力解决与邻国和贸易伙伴之间的经济、贸易和领土争端。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping called on Friday for the building of "bridges" in the global economy, as Beijing grapples with economic, trade and territorial disputes with neighbours and trading partners.】

item.title: Meta 表示可能在澳大利亚屏蔽 Facebook 的新闻报道
item.description: 脸书公司的一位代表周五在议会听证会上表示，如果澳大利亚政府要求脸书支付许可费，那么脸书的所有者 Meta 公司将考虑在澳大利亚屏蔽该平台上的新闻内容。【原文：Facebook owner Meta is considering blocking news content from the platform in Australia if the government makes it pay licensing fees, a company representative told a parliamentary hearing on Friday.】

item.title: 日元创 38 年新低，日本任命新外汇外交官
item.description: 在日元兑美元汇率跌至 38 年新低之际，日本周五任命了一位新的高级外汇外交官，这加剧了人们对东京即将进行市场干预以支撑受创货币的预期。【原文：Japan appointed a new top foreign exchange diplomat on Friday as the yen plumbed a 38-year low against the dollar, heightening expectations of imminent market intervention by Tokyo to shore up the battered currency.】

item.title: 美元突破 161 日元，有望实现季度上涨
item.description: 周五，在关键的美国通胀数据公布之前，美元连续第二个季度上涨，并跳升至近四十年来的新高，日元则受到重挫。【原文：The dollar was headed for a second straight quarterly gain and jumped to a near four-decade high on the battered yen in Asia trade on Friday, ahead of a crucial U.S. inflation reading.】
